intro: Tarenna guelcheriana var. mollis, commonly known as the silky tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its softly hairy foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its unique botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
